Reactions.The products were CO and H 2 in the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 with CH 4 .CO (3.6 mol) and H 2 (0.05 mol) were formed over MgO in the presence of CO 2 and CH 4 under photoirradiation for 5 h at room temperature.In a previous study, we reported the photocatalytic reduction of CO 2 in the presence of H 2 as a reductant. 29In this case, the CO evolution exhibited 2.9 mol after 6 h of photoirradiation.It was found that CH 4 as well as H 2 operates as a reductant for the photocatalytic reduction

out to identify a photoactive species in photoluminescence.Figure 10 shows phosphorescent excitation spectra of MgO (a) after pretreatment, (b) absorbing 33 molg-MgO -1 of CO 2 and (c) absorbing 66 molg-MgO -1 of CO 2 , and the inset is expanded at 280-380 nm.The emission light was monitored at 450 nm, because the maximum emission intensity was obtained at around that wavelength.The maximum excitation intensity, which was observed at 240 nm (5.2 eV), was assigned to excitation of bulk MgO.This result is
